name: Alpha Carinae
lore: This star hosts the planet Arrakis, the main setting for most of the Dune series.

name: Alpha Centauri
scifi_source: (Dune, Mass Effect, Ender's Game, Star Trek - TOS, Foundation)
lore: This binary star system is very prevalent within Scifi. In Dune, this system is home to the planets Ecaz and Logi. Home of Zefram Cochrane in the Star Trek universe, it also appears prominently near the end of the Foundation series.

name: Proxima Centauri
lore: Referenced and visualized as a nearby star system in future human space expansion. Also mentioned as a colony of Earth in Babylon 5

name: Andromeda
lore: Home of the Kelvans in the Star Trek universe, who try to take over our galaxy. In Rick and Morty season 8, the Andromeda Galaxy is revealed as the origin of the Easter Bunny, which is actually an alien bioweapon designed to induce overpopulation through pheromonal influence, attracting the attention of Space Christians, a faction dedicated to eradicating the Easter Bunnies.

name: Beta Lyncis
lore: Home to the planet Ishia, which was a holding of House Corrino in the Dune universe

name: Delta Pavonis
lore: Home of the planet Caladan, holidng of House Atreides and birthplace of Paul Muab Dib.

name: Epsilon Alangue
lore: Home of the planet Porithrim, thought to be the origin of the Zensunni wanderers (predecesors of the Fremen).

name: Gamma Piscium
lore: Home to several planets including Selusa Secundus, which was once the home planet of House Corrino.

name: Andromeda Galaxy
lore: Home of the Kelvans, who try to take over our galaxy.

name: Pinwheel Galaxy
lore: Mentioned in Star Trek TNG S1E6 Where No One Has Gone Before

name: Tau Ceti
scifi_source: (Star Trek -TNG, VOY, Mass Effect, The Expanse, Halo, Project Hail Mary)
lore: In Halo, this system was the site of operation first strike, where the Master Chief succesfully destroyed a massive Covenant armada set to invade Earth between Halo CE and 2. In the Expanse, this system was the set destination of the generation ship the Nauvou, before the ship was repurposed after the Eros incident. The system shows up as a colony in the Mass Effect games, and plays a prominent role in the book Project Hail Mary.

name: Delta Trianguli
lore: Delta Triangle where ships vanish.

name: Gamma Trianguli
lore: Gamma Trianguli VI guarded by Vaal.

name: Mira (Omicron Ceti)
lore: Ceti III: spores; Dytallix B: alien parasites.

name: Acamar
lore: Acamar III: Acamarian homeworld.

name: Menkar (Alpha Ceti)
lore: Ceti Alpha V: Khan marooned. VI: destroyed.

name: Pleiades
lore: Crystalline lifeform.

name: Keid (40 Eridani)
lore: Vulcan and sister planet T'Khut.

name: Hyadum I
lore: Gamma Tauri IV: Ferengi raid.

name: Aldebaran
lore: Aldebaran III: music academy.

name: Rigel
lore: Includes Rigel IV–XII planets in the Star Trek universe. It is also a star system containing several colonies and missions in Mass Effect galaxy map.

name: Capella
lore: Capella IV: topaline.

name: Mintaka
lore: Mintaka III: pre-industrial rational species.

name: Crab Nebula (M1)
lore: Mentioned by Lieutennent Data in 2365

name: Menkalinan
lore: Camus II: body-switch.

name: Canopus
lore: Starbase on Alpha Carinae V.

name: Pollux
lore: Pollux IV: home of ancient godlike aliens.

name: Ashlesha
lore: Epsilon Hydrae VII.

name: Regulus
lore: Regulus III: science academy.

name: Wolf 359
lore: Site of Borg battle.

name: Merak
lore: Merak II: plague, zenite needed.

name: Cor Caroli
lore: Cor Caroli V: Phyrox plague.

name: Cauda Hydrae
lore: Gamma Hydrae IV: aging disease.

name: Mizar
lore: Mizar II: conquered multiple times.

name: Izar
lore: Elba II: insane asylum.

name: Antares
lore: Beta Antares IV: card game.

name: Atria
lore: Briefly mentioned.

name: Barnard’s
lore: In the Star Trek universe, the planet Matanda orbited Barnard's Star. In 2366, Starfleet Science Archaeology Division conducted an archaeological expedition to Matanda, led by Commander Anne Lansing aboard the USS Worsaae. It is also mentioned and depicted as a nearby star system during expansions and travel sequences

name: Vega
lore: Delta Vega & Vega IX planets in the Star Trek universe. It is also the source of the alien radio signal received by Earth, pivotal for first contact in the 1997 movie "Contact". Also mentioned as an Earth colony in Babylon 5

name: Sheliak
lore: Beta Lyrae system; Kzin home.

name: Alsafi
lore: Sigma Draconis VI: matriarchy.

name: Altair
lore: Altair III–VI: Federation worlds.

name: Deneb
lore: Deneb IV: Bandi homeworld.

name: Helix Nebula (NGC7293)
lore: Mentioned in Voyager novel.

name: HD95424
lore: Home to the planet Rossak, a stop on the Zensunni wanderers' migration to Arrakis

name: Iota Leporis
lore: Home to the planet Bela Tegeuse, a stop on the Zensunni wanderers' migration to Arrakis

name: 36 Ophiuchi
lore: Home of the planet Giedi Prime, home plaet of house Harkonnen.

name: Sirius
lore: Home star of the Goa’uld System Lords

name: Psi Draconis
lore: Home of the planets Grumman, Gamont, and Niushe, which all appear in the extended lore of teh Dune universe.

name: Sigma Draconis
lore: Home to planets Corrin and Ishkai, both prominent locations in the early history of the Imperium.

name: Theta Eridani A
lore: Home system of the Bene Tleilax, a mysterious group that specialized in genetic alteration.  This is also the home star for Rocky from Project Hail Mary book by Andy Weir.

name: Epsilon Eridani
lore: Home to several colonized planets in Halo, most notably Reach. One of the most important systems in the UNSC. In Star Trek, this system is the near several Klingon encounters (Epsilon IV, VIII).

name: Epsilon Eridani b
lore: Colonized planet in lore, key to some storylines and missions.

name: Theta Leonis
lore: Home of the planet Hagal, the source of many crown jewels in the Imperium

name: 61 Cygni
lore: This system was one of several theorized to be the origin system of humanity in the Foundation series.

name: Procyon
lore: Home of the outer colony Arcadia, which was indaded by the Covenant in 2531 and 2549

name: Alpha Aurigae
lore: A colony of the UEG in the Halo series, its status after the Human-Covenant war is unknown

name: 111 Tauri
lore: Home to the colony world Victoria in the Halo series

name: 18 Scorpii
lore: Home of the UEG colony Falaknuma, which hosted a large amount of Covenant war refugees in 2535

name: 23 Librae
lore: Home of the UEG colony Madrigal, a prominent location in the book Halo: the Cole Protocol

name: 26 Draconis
lore: Controlled by the UNSC and site of the Callisto incident in the 2490s, which marked the start of the insurrection

name: 51 Pegasi
lore: Home to several planets controlled by the Covenant, and the site of a spartan-III attack in 2545

name: Beta Hydri
lore: Stated to be an inner colony of the UEG, with at least 6 inhabited planets

name: Chi Ceti
lore: An outer colony of the UEG, this system has four documented planets, and is the location where the iconic Mjolnir power armor is manufactured.

name: Epsilon Indi
lore: Home to the outer colony Harvest and location where humanity first encountered the Covenant. In lore, this system is stated to be much further from Earth than in real life.

name: Gamma Pavonis
lore: Site of the Battle of Gamma Pavonis VII in 2550, where Midranda Keys defeated a Covanent destroyer and subsequently was awarded the silver star

name: Groombridge 1830
lore: Controlled by the UEG, and site of an unsuccesful Covenant invasion in 2530. Its current status is unknown.

name: Groombridge 34
lore: Site where Spartan-II Kurt 051 was kidnapped to assist in the Spartan-III program.

name: Lacaille 9352
lore: An innter colony of the UEG, this system hosted a derelict cruiser containing a modified set of Mjolnir power armor of unknown origin.

name: Lambda Aurigae
lore: Home to the outer colony Roost, known for its tropical beaches and fishing industry.

name: Lambda Serpentis
lore: Home to the colony Jericho VII, which was glassed by the Covenant in 2535. This system was the original home of Spartan Locke, the main character of Halo 5 Guardians.

name: LP 656-38
lore: In Halo, this system was originally inhabited by the Forerunners, and subsequently devastated by a Flood infestation bringing the population from 1.5 Billion to less than 9000.

name: Gliese 65
lore: In Halo, this sytem was home to the inner UEG colony Luyfen. One of the original spartan IIs (Caleb-095) was born here.

name: Psi Serpentis
lore: In Halo, this sytstem was the site of the battle of Psi Serpentis in 2549. In this battle, the UNSC succesfully destroyed a large Covenant armada by temprarilly igniting a gas giant in the system.

name: Theta Ursae Majoris
lore: In Halo, this system was an outer colony of the UEG, and was the site of several battles during the Insurrection in the early 2500s

name: XI Boötis A
lore: In Halo, this system was an outer colony of the UEG. In 2526, Admiral Cole succesfully defended this system against a Covenant invasion with heavy casualties.

name: Zeta Doradus
lore: In Halo, this system is home to the Forerunner shield world Onyx, which was the site of a prolonged battle between the UNSC, sentinal defense forces, and Covenant seperatists in 2552.

name: Algol
scifi_source: (The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy, Star Trek - TNG, That Share of Glory by C.M. Kornbluth)
lore: Mentioned in Star Trek TNG S1E6 and in the short story "That Share of Glory" by C.M. Kornbluth orignally published in 1952 in which there is a language called Algolian

name: Alphard
scifi_source: The Blind Pilot by Charles Henneberg
lore: Referred to as an ocean planet in Charles Henneberg's short story "The Blind Pilot" first published in 1959

name: Betelgeuse
scifi_source: (The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy, Babylon 5)
lore: In Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy, the home system of Ford Prefect and Zaphod Beeblebrox.
